source: Rage Against the Machine . The same year , growing tensions over the direction of the band prompted de la Rocha to quit , leading to the band 's breakup . De la Rocha started a low-key solo career , while the rest of the band formed the rock supergroup Audioslave with Chris Cornell , then-former frontman of Soundgarden ; Audioslave recorded three albums before disbanding in 2007 . The same year , Rage Against the Machine announced a reunion and performed together for the first time in seven years at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in April 2007 . Renegades is the fourth studio album by the American rap metal band Rage Against the Machine , released on December 5 , 2000 by Epic Records .
summary: Rage Against the Machine's lead vocalist, Zack de la Rocha, left the band in the same year due to creative differences, causing the band to disband. De la Rocha pursued a low-key solo career, while the remaining members formed Audioslave with Chris Cornell, the former frontman of Soundgarden. Audioslave released three albums before disbanding in 2007. In the same year, Rage Against the Machine reunited and performed at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival. Their fourth studio album, "Renegades," was released in 2000.

Rage Against the Machine, a rap metal band, experienced a breakup in 1997 due to tensions, leading vocalist Zack de la Rocha to pursue a solo career. The remaining members formed the rock supergroup Audioslave with Soundgarden's Chris Cornell, releasing three albums before disbanding in 2007. In April 2007, Rage Against the Machine reunited and performed at Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival. Their fourth studio album, "Renegades," was released on December 5, 2000, by Epic Records.
